member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.Actor.StartTimer(System.TimeSpan,Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.Timers.TimerElapsedEvent)
member.summary: Starts a timer that sends a to this actor after the specified due time. The timer accepts an optional payload to be used during timeout. The timer is automatically disposed after it timeouts. To manually stop and dispose the timer, invoke the method.
member.remarks: See Using timers in actors for more information.
member.param: The amount of time to wait before sending the timeout event.
Optional custom event to raise instead of the default TimerElapsedEvent.
member.returns: Handle that contains information about the timer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.Actor.StartPeriodicTimer(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.Timers.TimerElapsedEvent)
member.summary: Starts a periodic timer that sends a to this actor after the specified due time, and then repeats after each specified period. The timer accepts an optional payload to be used during timeout. The timer can be stopped by invoking the method.
member.remarks: See Using timers in actors for more information.
member.param: The amount of time to wait before sending the first timeout event.
The time interval between timeout events.
Optional custom event to raise instead of the default TimerElapsedEvent.
member.returns: Handle that contains information about the timer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.Actor.StopTimer(Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.Timers.TimerInfo)
member.summary: Stops and disposes the specified timer.

member.param: Handle that contains information about the timer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.AwaitableEventGroup`1
member.summary: An object representing an awaitable long running context involving one or more actors. An `AwaitableEventGroup` can be provided as an optional argument in CreateActor and SendEvent. If a null `AwaitableEventGroup` is passed then the `EventGroup` is inherited from the sender or target actors (based on which ever one has a ). In this way an `AwaitableEventGroup` is automatically communicated to all actors involved in completing some larger operation. Each actor involved can find the `AwaitableEventGroup` using their property.
member.typeparam: The result returned when the operation is completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.AwaitableEventGroup`1.Tcs
member.summary: A task completion source that can be awaited to get the final result object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.AwaitableEventGroup`1.Task
member.summary: Gets the task created by this `AwaitableEventGroup`.

member.summary: Indicates the `AwaitableEventGroup` has been completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.AwaitableEventGroup`1.IsCanceled
member.summary: Value that indicates whether the task completed execution due to being canceled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.AwaitableEventGroup`1.IsFaulted
member.summary: Value that indicates whether the task completed due to an unhandled exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.AwaitableEventGroup`1.#ctor(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The id for this `AwaitableEventGroup` (defaults to Guid.Empty).
An optional friendly name for this `EventGroup`.

member.summary: Transitions the underlying task into the state.
member.param: The completed result object.

member.summary: Attempts to transition the underlying task into the state.
member.param: The completed result object.

member.summary: Transitions the underlying task into the state.

member.summary: Attempts to transition the underlying task into the state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.EventGroup
member.summary: An object representing a long running context involving one or more actors. An `EventGroup` can be provided as an optional argument in CreateActor and SendEvent. If a null `EventGroup` is passed then the `EventGroup` is inherited from the sender or target actors (based on which ever one has a ). In this way an `EventGroup` is automatically communicated to all actors involved in completing some larger operation. Each actor involved can find the `EventGroup` using their property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.IActorRuntime.CreateActorIdFromName(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a actor id that is uniquely tied to the specified unique name. The returned actor id can either be a fresh id (not yet bound to any actor), or it can be bound to a previously created actor. In the second case, this actor id can be directly used to communicate with the corresponding actor.
member.param: Type of the actor.
Unique name used to create or get the actor id.
member.returns: The result is the actor id.

member.summary: Invoked when the specified monitor enters or exits a state.

The name of the state being entered or exited; if is not null, then the temperature is appended to the statename in brackets, e.g. "stateName[hot]".
If true, this is called for a state entry; otherwise, exit.
If true, the monitor is in a hot state; if false, the monitor is in a cold state; else no liveness state is available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.ActionCache
member.summary: Cache of state machine types to a map of action names to action declarations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.ActionCacheLocks
member.summary: A set of lockable objects used to protect static initialization of the ActionCache while also enabling multithreaded initialization of different StateMachine types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.StateTypeCache
member.summary: Cache of state machine types to a set of all possible states types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.StateInstanceCache
member.summary: Cache of state machine types to a set of all available state instances.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.StateStack
member.summary: A stack of states. The state on the top of the stack represents the current state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.InheritableEventHandlerMap
member.summary: A map from event type to a Stack of HandlerInfo where the stack contains the inheritable event handlers defined by each state that has been pushed onto the StateStack (if any). The HandlerInfo also remembers which state the handler was defined on so that when the handler is invoked the IActorRuntimeLog can be given that information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.EventHandlerMap
member.summary: A map from event type to EventHandlerDeclaration for those EventHandlerDeclarations that are not inheritable on the state stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.EmptyEventHandlerMap
member.summary: This is just so we don't have to allocate an empty map more than once.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.StateMachineActionMap
member.summary: Map from action names to cached action delegates for all states in this state machine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.RaiseEvent(Microsoft.Coyote.Event)
member.summary: Raises the specified at the end of the current action.
member.remarks: This event is not handled until the action that calls this method returns control back to the Coyote runtime. It is handled before any other events are dequeued from the inbox. Only one of the following can be called per action: , , or and . An Assert is raised if you accidentally try and do two of these operations in a single action.
member.param: The event to raise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.RaiseGotoStateEvent``1
member.summary: Raise a special event that performs a goto state operation at the end of the current action.

member.summary: Raise a special event that performs a goto state operation at the end of the current action.
member.param: Type of the state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.RaisePushStateEvent``1
member.summary: Raise a special event that performs a push state operation at the end of the current action.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.RaisePushStateEvent(System.Type)
member.summary: Raise a special event that performs a push state operation at the end of the current action.
member.param: Type of the state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.RaisePopStateEvent
member.summary: Raise a special event that performs a pop state operation at the end of the current action.
member.remarks:
Popping a state pops the current that was pushed using or an OnEventPushStateAttribute. An assert is raised if there are no states left to pop. This event is not handled until the action that calls this method returns control back to the Coyote runtime. It is handled before any other events are dequeued from the inbox.
Only one of the following can be called per action: , , or and . An Assert is raised if you accidentally try and do two of these operations in a single action.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.RaiseHaltEvent
member.summary: Raises a to halt the actor at the end of the current action.
member.remarks:
This event is not handled until the action that calls this method returns control back to the Coyote runtime. It is handled before any other events are dequeued from the inbox.
Only one of the following can be called per action: , , or and . An Assert is raised if you accidentally try and do two of these operations in a single action.

member.summary: Notification that the current state has changed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.OnEventHandledAsync(Microsoft.Coyote.Event)
member.summary: Asynchronous callback that is invoked when the actor finishes handling a dequeued event, unless the handler of the dequeued event raised an event or caused the actor to halt (either normally or due to an exception). Unless this callback raises an event, the actor will either become idle or dequeue the next event from its inbox.
member.param: The event that was handled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.Transition
member.summary: Defines the transition that is the result of executing an event handler. Transitions are created by using , , or and . The Transition is processed by the Coyote runtime when an event handling method of a StateMachine returns a Transition object. This means such a method can only do one such Transition per method call. If the method wants to do a conditional transition it can return Transition.None to indicate no transition is to be performed.
member.remarks: See State machines for more information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Actors.StateMachine.HandlerInfo.StackDepth
member.summary: Records where this State is in the StateStack. This information is needed to implement WildCardEvent semantics. A specific Handler closest to the top of the stack (higher StackDepth) wins over a WildCardEvent further down the stack (lower StackDepth).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration
member.summary: The Coyote project configurations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ToolCommand
member.summary: The user-specified command to perform by the Coyote tool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.AdditionalPaths
member.summary: Something to add to the PATH environment at test time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.OutputFilePath
member.summary: The output path.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.AssemblyToBeAnalyzed
member.summary: The assembly to be analyzed for bugs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.RewritingOptionsPath
member.summary: The path to the binary rewriting configuration file or a folder containing assemblies to rewrite.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TestMethodName
member.summary: Test method to be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.SchedulingStrategy
member.summary: The systematic testing strategy to use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TestingIterations
member.summary: Number of testing iterations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TestingTimeout
member.summary: Timeout in seconds after which no more testing iterations will run.
member.remarks: Setting this value overrides the value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.RandomGeneratorSeed
member.summary: Custom seed to be used by the random value generator. By default, this value is null indicating that no seed has been set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IncrementalSchedulingSeed
member.summary: If true, the seed will increment in each testing iteration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.PerformFullExploration
member.summary: If true, the Coyote tester performs a full exploration, and does not stop when it finds a bug.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.MaxUnfairSchedulingSteps
member.summary: The maximum scheduling steps to explore for unfair schedulers. By default this is set to 10,000 steps.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.MaxFairSchedulingSteps
member.summary: The maximum scheduling steps to explore for fair schedulers. By default this is set to 100,000 steps.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.UserExplicitlySetMaxFairSchedulingSteps
member.summary: True if the user has explicitly set the fair scheduling steps.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ConsiderDepthBoundHitAsBug
member.summary: If true, then the Coyote tester will consider an execution that hits the depth bound as buggy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.StrategyBound
member.summary: A strategy-specific bound.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TimeoutDelay
member.summary: Value that controls the probability of triggering a timeout each time or a built-in timer is scheduled during systematic testing. Decrease the value to increase the frequency of timeouts (e.g. a value of 1 corresponds to a 50% probability), or increase the value to decrease the frequency (e.g. a value of 10 corresponds to a 10% probability). By default this value is 10.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.SafetyPrefixBound
member.summary: Safety prefix bound. By default it is 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsPartiallyControlledTestingEnabled
member.summary: If this option is enabled, systematic testing supports partially controlled executions.
member.remarks: This is an experimental feature.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsLivenessCheckingEnabled
member.summary: If this option is enabled, liveness checking is enabled during systematic testing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.LivenessTemperatureThreshold
member.summary: The liveness temperature threshold. If it is 0 then it is disabled. By default this value is assigned to / 2.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.UserExplicitlySetLivenessTemperatureThreshold
member.summary: True if the user has explicitly set the liveness temperature threshold.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsProgramStateHashingEnabled
member.summary: If this option is enabled, the tester is hashing the program state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsMonitoringEnabledInInProduction
member.summary: If this option is enabled, (safety) monitors are used in the production runtime.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.AttachDebugger
member.summary: Attaches the debugger during trace replay.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ScheduleFile
member.summary: The schedule file to be replayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ScheduleTrace
member.summary: The schedule trace to be replayed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsVerbose
member.summary: If true, then messages are logged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsDebugVerbosityEnabled
member.summary: If true, then debug verbosity is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.LogLevel
member.summary: The level of detail to provide in verbose logging.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ReportCodeCoverage
member.summary: Enables code coverage reporting of a Coyote program.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ReportActivityCoverage
member.summary: Enables activity coverage reporting of a Coyote program.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.DebugActivityCoverage
member.summary: Enables activity coverage debugging.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsDgmlBugGraph
member.summary: Is DGML graph showing all test iterations or just one "bug" iteration. False means all, and True means only the iteration containing a bug.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsDgmlGraphEnabled
member.summary: If specified, requests a DGML graph of the iteration that contains a bug, if a bug is found. This is different from a coverage activity graph, as it will also show actor instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.IsXmlLogEnabled
member.summary: Produce an XML formatted runtime log file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.CustomActorRuntimeLogType
member.summary: If specified, requests a custom runtime log to be used instead of the default. This is the AssemblyQualifiedName of the type to load.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ParallelBugFindingTasks
member.summary: Number of parallel systematic testing tasks. By default it is 1 task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.ParallelDebug
member.summary: Put a debug prompt at the beginning of each child TestProcess.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TestingSchedulerIpAddress
member.summary: Specify ip address if you want to use something other than localhost.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WaitForTestingProcesses
member.summary: Do not automatically launch the TestingProcesses in parallel mode, instead wait for them to be launched independently.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.RunAsParallelBugFindingTask
member.summary: Runs this process as a parallel systematic testing task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TestingSchedulerEndPoint
member.summary: The testing scheduler unique endpoint.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TestingProcessId
member.summary: The unique testing process id.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.AdditionalCodeCoverageAssemblies
member.summary: Additional assembly specifications to instrument for code coverage, besides those in the dependency graph between and the Microsoft.Coyote DLLs. Key is filename, value is whether it is a list file (true) or a single file (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.EnableColoredConsoleOutput
member.summary: Enables colored console output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.DisableEnvironmentExit
member.summary: If true, then environment exit will be disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.EnableTelemetry
member.summary: Enable Coyote sending Telemetry to Azure which is used to help improve the tool (default true).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.PlatformVersion
member.summary: The .NET platform version being used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.TelemetryServerPath
member.summary: Optional location of app that can run as a telemetry server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.Create
member.summary: Creates a new configuration with default values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithRandomStrategy
member.summary: Updates the configuration to use the random scheduling strategy during systematic testing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithProbabilisticStrategy(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the configuration to use the probabilistic scheduling strategy during systematic testing. You can specify a value controlling the probability of each scheduling decision. This value is specified as the integer N in the equation 0.5 to the power of N. So for N=1, the probability is 0.5, for N=2 the probability is 0.25, N=3 you get 0.125, etc. By default, this value is 3.
member.param: The probability level.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithPCTStrategy(System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the configuration to use the PCT scheduling strategy during systematic testing. You can specify the number of priority switch points, which by default are 10.
member.param: If true, use the fair version of PCT.
The nunmber of priority switch points.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithDFSStrategy
member.summary: Updates the configuration to use the dfs scheduling strategy during systematic testing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithReplayStrategy(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the configuration to use the replay scheduling strategy during systematic testing. This strategy replays the specified schedule trace to reproduce the same execution.
member.param: The schedule trace to be replayed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithTestingIterations(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the configuration with the specified number of iterations to run during systematic testing.
member.param: The number of iterations to run.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithTestingTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the configuration with the specified systematic testing timeout in seconds.
member.param: The timeout value in seconds.
member.remarks: Setting this value overrides the value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithMaxSchedulingSteps(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the configuration with the specified number of maximum scheduling steps to explore per iteration during systematic testing. The is assigned the value, whereas the is assigned a value using the default heuristic, which is 10 * .
member.param: The maximum scheduling steps to explore per iteration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithMaxSchedulingSteps(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the configuration with the specified number of maximum unfair and fair scheduling steps to explore per iteration during systematic testing. It is recommended to use instead of this overloaded method.
member.param: The unfair scheduling steps to explore per iteration.
The fair scheduling steps to explore per iteration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithPartiallyControlledTestingEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the configuration with partially controlled testing enabled or disabled.
member.param: If true, then partially controlled testing is enabled.
member.remarks: This is an experimental feature.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithLivenessTemperatureThreshold(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the configuration with the specified liveness temperature threshold during systematic testing. If this value is 0 it disables liveness checking. It is not recommended to explicitly set this value, instead use the default value which is assigned to / 2.
member.param: The liveness temperature threshold.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithTimeoutDelay(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the value that controls the probability of triggering a timeout each time or a built-in timer is scheduled during systematic testing.
member.param: The timeout delay during testing.
member.remarks: Increase the value to decrease the probability. This value is not a unit of time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Configuration.WithRandomGeneratorSeed(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the seed used by the random value generator during systematic testing.
member.param: The seed used by the random value generator.

member.summary: Updates the configuration with verbose output enabled or disabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.Random.Generator
member.summary: Represents a pseudo-random value generator, which is an algorithm that produces a sequence of values that meet certain statistical requirements for randomness. During systematic testing, the generation of random values is controlled, which allows the runtime to explore combinations of choices to find bugs.
member.remarks: See Program non-determinism for more information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Specifications.Monitor.RaiseEvent(Microsoft.Coyote.Event)
member.summary: Raises the specified at the end of the current action.
member.remarks: This event is not handled until the action that calls this method returns control back to the Coyote runtime. It is handled before any other events are dequeued from the inbox. Only one of the following can be called per action: , . An Assert is raised if you accidentally try and do two of these operations in a single action.
member.param: The event to raise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Specifications.Monitor.RaiseGotoStateEvent``1
member.summary: Raise a special event that performs a goto state operation at the end of the current action.
member.remarks:
Goto state pops the current and pushes the specified on the active state stack.
This is shorthand for the following code:
class Event E { } [OnEventGotoState(typeof(E), typeof(S))] this.RaiseEvent(new E());
This event is not handled until the action that calls this method returns control back to the Coyote runtime. It is handled before any other events are dequeued from the inbox. Only one of the following can be called per action: , . An Assert is raised if you accidentally try and do two of these operations in a single action.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.Specifications.Monitor.Transition
member.summary: Defines the transition that is the result of executing an event handler. Transitions are created by using , or . The Transition is processed by the Coyote runtime when an event handling method returns a Transition object. This means such a method can only do one such Transition per method call. If the method wants to do a conditional transition it can return Transition.None to indicate no transition is to be performed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor
member.summary: Provides methods for monitors that can be controlled during testing.
member.remarks: This type is intended for compiler use rather than use directly in code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Enter(System.Object)
member.summary: Acquires an exclusive lock on the specified object.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the monitor lock.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Enter(System.Object,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Acquires an exclusive lock on the specified object.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the monitor lock.

The result of the attempt to acquire the lock, passed by reference. The input must be false. The output is true if the lock is acquired; otherwise, the output is false. The output is set even if an exception occurs during the attempt to acquire the lock. Note that if no exception occurs, the output of this method is always true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Exit(System.Object)
member.summary: Releases an exclusive lock on the specified object.
member.param: The object on which to release the lock.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.IsEntered(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the current thread holds the lock on the specified object.
member.param: The object to test.
member.returns: True if the current thread holds the lock on obj, else false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Pulse(System.Object)
member.summary: Notifies a thread in the waiting queue of a change in the locked object's state.
member.param: The object that sends the pulse.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.PulseAll(System.Object)
member.summary: Notifies all waiting threads of a change in the object's state.
member.param: The object that sends the pulse.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.TryEnter(System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Attempts, for the specified amount of time, to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object, and atomically sets a value that indicates whether the lock was taken.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.
The amount of time to wait for the lock. A value of 1 millisecond specifies an infinite wait.

The result of the attempt to acquire the lock, passed by reference. The input must be false. The output is true if the lock is acquired; otherwise, the output is false. The output is set even if an exception occurs during the attempt to acquire the lock. Note that if no exception occurs, the output of this method is always true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.TryEnter(System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Attempts, for the specified amount of time, to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object, and atomically sets a value that indicates whether the lock was taken.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.
The amount of time to wait for the lock. A value of 1 millisecond specifies an infinite wait.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.TryEnter(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Attempts, for the specified number of milliseconds, to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object, and atomically sets a value that indicates whether the lock was taken.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.
The number of milliseconds to wait for the lock.

The result of the attempt to acquire the lock, passed by reference. The input must be false. The output is true if the lock is acquired; otherwise, the output is false. The output is set even if an exception occurs during the attempt to acquire the lock.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.TryEnter(System.Object,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object, and atomically sets a value that indicates whether the lock was taken.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.

The result of the attempt to acquire the lock, passed by reference. The input must be false. The output is true if the lock is acquired; otherwise, the output is false. The output is set even if an exception occurs during the attempt to acquire the lock.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.TryEnter(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object.
member.param: The object on which to acquire the lock.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Wait(System.Object)
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock.
member.param: The object on which to wait.
member.returns: True if the call returned because the caller reacquired the lock for the specified object. This method does not return if the lock is not reacquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Wait(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock. If the specified time-out interval elapses, the thread enters the ready queue.
member.param: The object on which to wait.
The number of milliseconds to wait before the thread enters the ready queue.
member.returns: True if the lock was reacquired before the specified time elapsed, else false if the lock was reacquired after the specified time elapsed. The method does not return until the lock is reacquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Wait(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock. If the specified time-out interval elapses, the thread enters the ready queue. This method also specifies whether the synchronization domain for the context (if in a synchronized context) is exited before the wait and reacquired afterward.
member.param: The object on which to wait.
The number of milliseconds to wait before the thread enters the ready queue.
True to exit and reacquire the synchronization domain for the context (if in a synchronized context) before the wait, else false.
member.returns: True if the lock was reacquired before the specified time elapsed, else false if the lock was reacquired after the specified time elapsed. The method does not return until the lock is reacquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Wait(System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock. If the specified time-out interval elapses, the thread enters the ready queue.
member.param: The object on which to wait.
A representing the amount of time to wait before the thread enters the ready queue.
member.returns: True if the lock was reacquired before the specified time elapsed, else false if the lock was reacquired after the specified time elapsed. The method does not return until the lock is reacquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledMonitor.Wait(System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock. If the specified time-out interval elapses, the thread enters the ready queue. Optionally exits the synchronization domain for the synchronized context before the wait and reacquires the domain afterward.
member.param: The object on which to wait.
A representing the amount of time to wait before the thread enters the ready queue.
True to exit and reacquire the synchronization domain for the context (if in a synchronized context) before the wait, else false.
member.returns: True if the lock was reacquired before the specified time elapsed, else false if the lock was reacquired after the specified time elapsed. The method does not return until the lock is reacquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledTask.Yield
member.summary: Creates an awaitable that asynchronously yields back to the current context when awaited.
member.remarks: You can use `await Task.Yield()` in an asynchronous method to force the method to complete asynchronously. During systematic testing, the underlying scheduling strategy can use this as a hint on how to better prioritize this work relative to other work that may be pending.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread
member.summary: Provides a controlled thread class that creates and controls a thread, sets its priority, and gets its status and provides other helper methods like SpinWait and Yield that Coyote needs to intercept.
member.remarks: This type is intended for compiler use rather than use directly in code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.ClearCache
member.summary: This iks called after each test iteration is complete just so this dictionary doesn't get too big with junk threads.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Create(System.Threading.ThreadStart)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Threading.Thread class.
member.param: A System.Threading.ThreadStart delegate that represents the methods to be invoked when this thread begins executing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Create(System.Threading.ThreadStart,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Threading.Thread class.
member.param: A System.Threading.ThreadStart delegate that represents the methods to be invoked when this thread begins executing.

The maximum stack size, in bytes, to be used by the thread, or 0 to use the default maximum stack size specified in the header for the executable. Important For partially trusted code, maxStackSize is ignored if it is greater than the default stack size. No exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Create(System.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Threading.Thread class.
member.param: A System.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart delegate that represents the methods to be invoked when this thread begins executing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Create(System.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Threading.Thread class.
member.param: A System.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart delegate that represents the methods to be invoked when this thread begins executing.

The maximum stack size, in bytes, to be used by the thread, or 0 to use the default maximum stack size specified in the header for the executable. Important For partially trusted code, maxStackSize is ignored if it is greater than the default stack size. No exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.ScheduleAction(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedule a Coyote task to run the action.
member.param: The action to schedule.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Sleep(System.Int32)
member.summary: Suspends the current thread for the specified number of milliseconds.
member.param: The number of milliseconds for which the thread is suspended. If the value of the millisecondsTimeout argument is zero, the thread relinquishes the remainder of its time slice to any thread of equal priority that is ready to run. If there are no other threads of equal priority that are ready to run, execution of the current thread is not suspended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Sleep(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Suspends the current thread for the specified amount of time.
member.param: The amount of time for which the thread is suspended. If the value of the millisecondsTimeout argument is System.TimeSpan.Zero, the thread relinquishes the remainder of its time slice to any thread of equal priority that is ready to run. If there are no other threads of equal priority that are ready to run, execution of the current thread is not suspended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.SpinWait(System.Int32)
member.summary: Causes a thread to wait the number of times defined by the iterations parameter.
member.param: A 32-bit signed integer that defines how long a thread is to wait.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Yield
member.summary: Causes the calling thread to yield execution to another thread that is ready to run on the current processor. The operating system selects the thread to yield to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Join(System.Threading.Thread,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the thread represented by this instance terminates or the specified time elapses, while continuing to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping.
member.param: The thread to join.
A System.TimeSpan set to the amount of time to wait for the thread to terminate.
member.returns: true if the thread terminated; false if the thread has not terminated after the amount of time specified by the timeout parameter has elapsed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Join(System.Threading.Thread,System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the thread represented by this instance terminates or the specified time elapses, while continuing to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping.
member.param: The thread to join.
The number of milliseconds to wait for the thread to terminate.
member.returns: true if the thread has terminated; false if the thread has not terminated after the amount of time specified by the millisecondsTimeout parameter has elapsed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Join(System.Threading.Thread)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the thread represented by this instance terminates, while continuing to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping.
member.param: The thread to join.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Start(System.Threading.Thread,System.Object)
member.summary: Causes the operating system to change the state of the current instance to System.Threading.ThreadState.Running, and optionally supplies an object containing data to be used by the method the thread executes.
member.param: The thread to start.
An object that contains data to be used by the method the thread executes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.SystematicTesting.Interception.ControlledThread.Start(System.Threading.Thread)
member.summary: Causes the operating system to change the state of the current instance to System.Threading.ThreadState.Running.
member.param: The thread to start.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.SynchronizedBlock
member.summary: Provides a mechanism that synchronizes access to objects. It is implemented as a thin wrapper on . During testing, the implementation is automatically replaced with a controlled mocked version. It can be used as a replacement of the lock keyword to allow systematic testing.

member.summary: The object used for synchronization.

member.summary: True if the lock was taken, else false.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The sync object to serialize access to.

member.summary: Creates a new for synchronizing access to the specified object and enters the lock.
member.returns: The synchronized block.

member.summary: Enters the lock.
member.returns: The synchronized block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.SynchronizedBlock.Pulse
member.summary: Notifies a thread in the waiting queue of a change in the locked object's state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.SynchronizedBlock.PulseAll
member.summary: Notifies all waiting threads of a change in the object's state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.SynchronizedBlock.Wait
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock.
member.returns: True if the call returned because the caller reacquired the lock for the specified object. This method does not return if the lock is not reacquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.SynchronizedBlock.Wait(System.Int32)
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock. If the specified time-out interval elapses, the thread enters the ready queue.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait before the thread enters the ready queue.
member.returns: True if the lock was reacquired before the specified time elapsed; false if the lock was reacquired after the specified time elapsed. The method does not return until the lock is reacquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.SynchronizedBlock.Wait(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Releases the lock on an object and blocks the current thread until it reacquires the lock. If the specified time-out interval elapses, the thread enters the ready queue.
member.param: A System.TimeSpan representing the amount of time to wait before the thread enters the ready queue.
member.returns: True if the lock was reacquired before the specified time elapsed; false if the lock was reacquired after the specified time elapsed. The method does not return until the lock is reacquired.

member.summary: Releases resources used by the synchronized block.

member.summary: Creates an awaitable that asynchronously yields back to the current context when awaited.
member.remarks: You can use `await Task.Yield()` in an asynchronous method to force the method to complete asynchronously. During systematic testing, the underlying scheduling strategy can use this as a hint on how to better prioritize this work relative to other work that may be pending.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.Task.Wait

member.summary: Waits for the task to complete execution within a specified time interval.
member.param: A time span that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or TimeSpan.FromMilliseconds(-1) to wait indefinitely.
member.returns: True if the task completed execution within the allotted time; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.Task.Wait(System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits for the task to complete execution within a specified number of milliseconds.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait, or -1 to wait indefinitely.
member.returns: True if the task completed execution within the allotted time; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.Task.Wait(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Waits for the task to complete execution. The wait terminates if a cancellation token is canceled before the task completes.
member.param: A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.Task.Wait(System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Waits for the task to complete execution. The wait terminates if a timeout interval elapses or a cancellation token is canceled before the task completes.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait, or -1 to wait indefinitely.
A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.
member.returns: True if the task completed execution within the allotted time; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Coyote.Tasks.TaskExtensions.WrapInControlledTask(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Returns a dummy controlled that wraps this uncontrolled .
member.remarks: The returned dummy controlled does not actually take control of the uncontrolled during systematic testing, so this method should only be used to cross an interface boundary where a controlled must be temporarily converted into an uncontrolled and then coverted back to a controlled .
